title: When integration cannot proceed (for example merge conflicts), emit a durable `integration_blocked` outcome with evidence and resumable follow-up workflow.

five_acts.act_1_context: Blocked integrations previously risked becoming dead-end outcomes without durable evidence or a deterministic way to resume after remediation.
five_acts.act_2_build: Added a strict integration_blocked event contract, durable blocked follow-up linkage, and a lease-guarded resume flow that rechecks readiness before re-queueing.
five_acts.act_3_conflict: Review highlighted event-contract coupling and resume-observability concerns, plus linkage and persistence edge-case coverage gaps.
five_acts.act_4_resolution: The delivery reached APPROVE in round one with issues documented as Important and Suggestions for hardening in follow-up iterations.
five_acts.act_5_outcome: Integration failures now produce actionable, traceable blocked outcomes with follow-up ownership and a safe path back into deterministic queue processing.
